bibl.title: Letter from Alice Meloan to Emilie Lawrence Reed, May 31, 1927

div1.p: This letter, written by a student of Edith R. Force, thanks Emilie Lawrence Reed for the life and work of Walter Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Alice Meloan to Emilie Lawrence Reed, May 31, 1927
div1.p:
As I haven't anything to
do I thought I would write to you. As I
am in the Science room. I am going through
school. I like it so well but it will
be out Thursday. I will be sorry of it.

I don't know what I will do this
summer but I hope I can go on a trip
somewhere. I get out of school at 2:45
every evening and it takes up at 8:15

I like science or in fact I like all
my studies. I hope I can be scientist
for I surely do like it. It isn't hard to
study thats the reason I like it so. But
of course all of my studies arent hard.
and I like them also. I also like Miss Force,
which is my science teacher.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours Alice Meloan
1023 So. College St.
Tulsa, Okla. This girl is a cripple
Hand and feet.
